font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.4791in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: I am informed that your Government is cultivating the Wattle somewhat extensively along your lines of Railway. This is what we should do in South Australia and as I intend bringing the matter before my Board soon, I should like to ascertain how the work is being carried out in Victoria in order that I may refer to this in communicating with the Board.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: Might I therefore beg of you to ask the proper authorities to kindly furnish me with the desired information.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: Trusting I do not hinder you too much.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
J. E. Brown
See M to A. Morrah, 28 October 1881.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
